definition.title: Definition
definition.value: Combined Credit History (CCH) is a report on an individual's credit history that combines and visualizes data from the Credit Bureau.

t1.text: The input data are credit history reports that have many differences between them.
t1.title: Standardization

t2.text: Merge credit histories, remove duplicates, calculate sums, payments and debt for each credit.
t2.title: Processing

t3.text: Indicate the presence of negative signs or positive requirements.
t3.title: Indication

t4.text: Order and display credits in parallel in order to simplify the relationship between payment periods and reduce the risk of specialist errors.
t4.title: Visualization

t5.text: Correction of Credit Bureau errors that violate customer evaluation requirements.
t5.title: Correction

t6.text: Provide information on the logic of decision-making regarding the displayed data.
t6.title: Autonomy

t7.text: Ability to make adjustments and connect additional Credit Bureaus.
t7.title: Flexibility
